<@881905303011086387>: RE: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/745077610685661265/1079815939979227137 

> > That 256bytes seems like a rather significant portion of the overall consensus fields lengths.
> > I wonder if we could consider dropping it from the receipts for the new SSZ tx type for 4844 txs?

Since you're working on this figured I'd ping you over here, but I wonder if the 0x5 SSZ tx type would be a good opportunity to remove the `logsBloom` field from type 0x5 receipts?  I think removing it from _all_ receipts as part of -6404 would probably be a bit too much scope creep for that EIP but since the 0x5 tx type in -4844 hasn't been fully accepted yet maybe that'd be a good middle ground?

Actually come to mention it, EIP-4844 doesn't actually specify the type 0x5 receipt format anywhere and probably should (e.g. -1559 includes `The EIP-2718 ReceiptPayload for this transaction is rlp([status, cumulative_transaction_gas_used, logs_bloom, logs])`).

content: Hmm I thought maybe the `receipt.LogsBloom` was there to make generating the `header.Bloom` easier but confirmed that at least in geth the code reaches past the `receipt.LogsBloom` and iterates over the `receipt.Logs` instead: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/core/types/bloom9.go#L108
